author: manunlp
content:
Yeah I know, but the "feature request" is to be able to very quickly link a peerID to its client type (Prysm, Teku, LH...).
Use case: In your logs you see an issue with a given peerID. You want to, in one view, being able to know the client type.

author: skylenet
content: You could search on the PeerDas column table. It has a search on top and will then highlight the boxes relevant to that node.

author: skylenet
content: and then click the box to get more infos for the node.

author: manunlp
content: thanks

author: skylenet
content: Or press "Show all" there, which will expand all nodes and show infos for all of them. And then just use the CTRL/CMD + F to search.

author: manunlp
content: Yeah it is what I do currently.

author: manunlp
content:
I thought it would be convenient to be able to achieve the same result without having to "show all".
Anyway, the peerDAS column table technique is fine, thanks!

author: dmitriishmatko
content:
I'm a bit confused with builder-api specs:
https://github.com/ethereum/builder-specs/pull/117/files#diff-d6df126e7b992abae5046fe1eed7402ecae259a79411d7ffb2ad0cb278ef9539R31
shouldn't `proofs` size be CELLS_PER_EXT_BLOB * MAX_BLOB_COMMITMENTS_PER_BLOCK instead?
and similar here adjusted:
https://github.com/ethereum/builder-specs/pull/117/files#diff-3afa87e366c0885fbcca6ec34b4bcd2a2f4d7971e022b6ef15d8e300ed0cf989R24

author: agnxsh

author: dmitriishmatko
content:
what's wrong with my config? getting spamoor error
```
additional_services:
  - dora
  - spamoor
  - prometheus_grafana
spamoor_params:
  spammers:
    - scenario: blobs
      config:
        throughput: 6
```

author: parithosh
content: ..that looks fine - whats the error?

author: jtraglia
content: Hey <@425907307621122049>, no that's right. It should be `FIELD_ELEMENTS_PER_EXT_BLOB`. It's like this for future proofing, in case we make cells smaller.

author: jtraglia
content: My PR [here](https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/pull/4187) provides a little rationale: "The max length would accommodate 4096 blobs where each field element were a cell."

author: francis.li
content: Hey <@808969530608451584> <@412614104222531604> <@199561711278227457> sorry if I missed this, how can I configure spamoor to send tx with cell proofs after fulu hard fork? Is it implemented yet?

author: mininny
content: You can use the blob-v1 branch, and use these parameters to control the amount of v1 wrapper tx, and fulu activation timestamp: https://github.com/ethpandaops/spamoor/blob/4a91d5c5124a69b54d31c6ad012cdfc0316d76b8/scenarios/blobs/blobs.go#L88-L89

author: dmitriishmatko
content:
nice explanation, got it
Thank you!

author: parithosh
content: peerdas-devnet-5 has been deleted ðŸ˜„

author: pk910
content:
yes, it is supported, but not in the master image or latest release yet.
there is a separate image: `ethpandaops/spamoor:blob-v1`

you can launch a blob spammer that does v1 blobs only like this:
```yaml
# ...
additional_services:
  - dora
  - spamoor
spamoor_params:
  image: ethpandaops/spamoor:blob-v1
  spammers:
    - scenario: blob-combined
      config:
        throughput: 6 # 6 blob tx per block
        sidecars: 2   # up to 2 sidecars per tx
        blob_v1_percent: 100 # submit 100% of the txs as blob v1
```
